note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: Twitter Bootstrap Show Password plugin
tagline: Add's a button to a password input. No more "repeat your password".
body:
It's a very simple jQuery plugin that shows the content of a password input, so you don't need to add a "repeat your password" annoying input. ## Requirements * [Twitter Bootstrap](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/index.html) 2.1.0 and the [Tooltip plugin](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/javascript.html#tooltips). * [jQuery](http://jquery.com) 1.8.1. ## Usage Add the JS file. Create a normal Twitter Bootstrap input field for the password.
And then, call the plugin in the password input. $('#inputPassword').showPassword(); ## Change log ### 0.5 * First commit. Yay. ### 0.6 * Changed some callbacks and added the "click" trigger. ## Future changes * Add options like trigger, delay, etc.
